attributes.action: Give advanced information/lower grade boundaries for students doing A-Level’s.
attributes.additional_details:
It is not fair for some students elsewhere to have an advantage over others when we’re all competing for the same space in universities or apprenticeships.
The government has not considered the affects the strikes have had on our education at all.
Some schools still fill the effects of Covid-19 still. Multiple teaching positions are under-staffed and under-paid, at the end of the day making the student suffer the price.
attributes.background: Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland have all provided students with advanced information on their upcoming A-Level exam’s, whilst us in England who have been affected more by train strikes, tube strikes, more importantly teacher strikes have had to face the unknown with our A-Levels.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ensure fair grading for GCSE and A Level students in 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631743

Require exam boards provide advance information about 2023 exams: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/632547
